document_metadata.subject: Client Who Stood Up for Boies Goes Public in Sex Trafficking Case | Law.com

organizations: U.S. House Committee on Oversight and Accountability

relationships_and_connections.relationship: Plaintiff vs. defendant in sex trafficking lawsuit

content_analysis.purpose: To report on Sarah Ransome revealing her identity in Epstein lawsuit and defend David Boies
content_analysis.significance: Documents a key moment in Epstein case where a victim goes public, and reveals connections between high-profile legal cases

legal_concerns: Ethical concerns about Boies representing Weinstein while The New York Times was a client
Statute of limitations issues in Epstein case

notable_quotes: "For the first time in 10 years I finally feel safe because of David Boies and his colleagues" - Sarah Ransome
"Boies 'heard me and came to my rescue' when others refused to take her allegations against Epstein seriously"
"In the hopes that her courage will inspire other Epstein victims to speak their truth" - Sigrid McCawley
red_flags_and_concerns: Pattern of wealthy individuals (Epstein, Weinstein) involved in sexual misconduct cases
Ethical conflict with Boies representing Weinstein while The New York Times was a client
Multiple victims coming forward with similar allegations against Epstein

indicators_found: Epstein forced Ransome to have sex for money
Reference to victims being controlled or manipulated
blackmail_coercion_indicators.rationale: The document explicitly states Epstein forced Ransome to have sex for money, which constitutes coercion

illegal_activity_evidence.rationale: This is a news article reporting on legal proceedings and allegations, not first-hand evidence of illegal activity by the sender
